page.title: 10SIR ROBERT GEFFERY'S SCHOOL
page.content: Sir Robert Geffery was a local person who went to London in the 17th century and became Lord Mayor(1686) as well as a member of The Worshipful Company of Ironmongers.He remembered Landrake in his Will,part of which is on a slate in Landrake Church. The present school bears his name in memory of the bequests he made,and is Voluntary Aided with members of the Ironmongers Company making up two thirds of the governing body. Children can start school from before their fifth birthday until eleven.At present on roll there are 105 children but this is likely to grow in the near future with housing developments. There are four full time members of staff and a part time teacher.Meals are cooked on site by the two cooks and the children are supervised at mealtimes by a dinner lady & teacher.
